valr
  • Home
  • Overview
  • Reference

Map signals over intervals.

Multiple mapping functions can be specified.

bed_map(x, y, ...)

concat(.data, sep = ",")

values_unique(.data, sep = ",")

values(.data, sep = ",")

first(.data)

last(.data)

Arguments

x
tbl of intervals
y
tbl of signals
...
name-value pairs of summary functions like min(), count(), concat().
.data
data
sep
separator character

Value

data_frame

Details

Variables from the `x` and `y` tables should be used with `.x` and `.y` suffixes.

Existing grouping variables are maintained in the output, but have `.x` or `.y` suffixes`.

Note

Column names have .x and .y suffixes.

See also

http://bedtools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/content/tools/map.html

Examples

x <- tibble::tribble(
 ~chrom, ~start, ~end,
 "chr1", 100, 250,
 "chr2", 250, 500)

y <- tibble::tribble(
 ~chrom, ~start, ~end, ~value,
 "chr1", 100, 250, 10,
 "chr1", 150, 250, 20,
 "chr2", 250, 500, 500)

# mean, median, sd etc
bed_map(x, y, sum = sum(value.y))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x   sum
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  chr1     100   250    30
#> 2  chr2     250   500   500
#> 
bed_map(x, y, min = min(value.y), max = max(value.y))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 5
#>   chrom start.x end.x   min   max
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  chr1     100   250    10    20
#> 2  chr2     250   500   500   500
#> 

bed_map(x, y, concat(value.y))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x `concat(value.y)`
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>             <chr>
#> 1  chr1     100   250             10,20
#> 2  chr2     250   500               500
#> 
bed_map(x, y, first(value.y))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x `first(value.y)`
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>            <dbl>
#> 1  chr1     100   250               10
#> 2  chr2     250   500              500
#> 
bed_map(x, y, last(value.y))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x `last(value.y)`
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1  chr1     100   250              20
#> 2  chr2     250   500             500
#> 

bed_map(x, y, absmax = abs(max(value.y)))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x absmax
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1  chr1     100   250     20
#> 2  chr2     250   500    500
#> 
bed_map(x, y, absmin = abs(min(value.y)))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x absmin
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1  chr1     100   250     10
#> 2  chr2     250   500    500
#> 
bed_map(x, y, count = length(value.y))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x count
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <int>
#> 1  chr1     100   250     2
#> 2  chr2     250   500     1
#> 
bed_map(x, y, count_distinct = length(unique(value.y)))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x count_distinct
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>          <int>
#> 1  chr1     100   250              2
#> 2  chr2     250   500              1
#> 

bed_map(x, y, vals = values(value.y))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x  vals
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>
#> 1  chr1     100   250 10,20
#> 2  chr2     250   500   500
#> 
bed_map(x, y, vals.unique = values_unique(value.y))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 4
#>   chrom start.x end.x vals.unique
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>       <chr>
#> 1  chr1     100   250       10,20
#> 2  chr2     250   500         500
#>
